meanings.definition: the act of making a correction or improvement
meanings.sent1: Her emendation of the essay greatly improved its clarity.
meanings.sent2: The teacher's emendation of the student's spelling mistakes was helpful.
meanings.sent3: The emendation of the recipe made it taste much better.
meanings.sent4: His emendation of the painting transformed it into a masterpiece.
meanings.sent5: The emendation of the garden with colorful flowers made it more beautiful.

meanings.definition: a change made to a text to correct errors
meanings.sent1: The editor's emendation of the manuscript fixed all the typos.
meanings.sent2: The emendation of the historical document clarified its meaning.
meanings.sent3: The emendation of the novel's plot twist surprised the readers.
meanings.sent4: Her emendation of the contract saved the company from a legal issue.
meanings.sent5: The emendation of the map's legend made it easier to understand.
